document_info.title: Gene expression profile dynamics of earthworms exposed to ZnO and ZnO:Mn nanomaterials

abstract.objective: To investigate the time-dependent gene expression response in earthworms exposed to ZnO nanomaterials and ZnO:Mn multicomponent nanomaterials.
exposure_conditions: Multiple sampling time points: 2, 4, and 14 days
key_findings: Strong differential gene expression after 4 days of ZnO exposure and after 2 days of ZnO:Mn exposure.
Moderate responses observed at 14 days for ZnO:Mn and MnCl2.
GO enrichment for ZnO-exposed worms: actin, muscle cells, contractile fibers, myofibrils, sarcomeres, supramolecular components.
Upregulated genes in ZnO:Mn-exposed worms (day 2): cilium, microtubule, cell projection, axoneme, sperm flagellum.
Downregulated genes in ZnO:Mn-exposed worms: ribosomes, mitochondria, translation, peptide processes, respiration, oxidative phosphorylation.
Limited GO enrichment at day 14 for both ZnO:Mn and MnCl2 exposures.
Transient molecular response related to muscle biology, energy metabolism, and translation that largely disappeared by day 14.
abstract.conclusion: Exposure to ZnO and ZnO:Mn nanomaterials elicits a transient transcriptional response in earthworms, primarily affecting muscle function and cellular energy production, which resolves by day 14.
